channel.title: Is this possible?
channel.description:
I was wondering if its possible if someone has a program on their computer such as aim (randomly pickin a program). Then when they go to my website, the website will open aim from their computer but have it embed on the website? If so plz give me the code :).
If u dont get what im talkin about let me know and ill try to restate my question.

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @mikeap4 mikeap4
item.description:
@mikeap4 wrote:

crap! well thanks anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

You can load applications from the browser using something like VBScript (obviously it’ll only work in IE) but you can’t embed it in the browser…it’s impossible as Bang Train said.

Mopar’s webclient and AIM express are different…the webclient is just the java client which was coded in java and as an applet anyway. The AIM express is a specially coded version of the AIM client in java so it can be run in the browsers. So unless you’d like to do a fair bit of coding, you can’t embed applications in the browser,

Read full topic

item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

his client is a java applet, and the aim express is the web client for AIM.

Read full topic
